SEARCH
Package ca.ucalgary.edu.ensf380

Class NewsProvider

java.lang.Object
ca.ucalgary.edu.ensf380.DataRetriever
ca.ucalgary.edu.ensf380.NewsAPI
ca.ucalgary.edu.ensf380.NewsProvider
public class NewsProvider extends NewsAPI
Provides news content by fetching data from a specified endpoint and displaying it in a Swing JPanel. This class is designed to handle news articles, including their titles, descriptions, and images.

  • Constructor Details

    • NewsProvider

      public NewsProvider(String ENDPOINT, String headline, String content)
      Constructs a new NewsProvider with the specified endpoint, headline, and content.
      Parameters:
      ENDPOINT - the endpoint URL for the news data API
      headline - the headline of the news
      content - the content of the news

    • NewsProvider

      public NewsProvider(String ENDPOINT)
      Overloaded constructor for testing purposes. Initializes the news provider with the given endpoint and sets default values for the headline and content. Configures the JPanel to display news content.
      Parameters:
      ENDPOINT - The endpoint URL to fetch news data from.

  • Method Details

      Gets the current headline of the news.

    • getContent

      public String getContent()
      Gets the current content of the news.
      Returns:
      The current content.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the news content in the JPanel. This method fetches news data from the specified endpoint, parses the data to extract the first article's title, description, and image, and updates the panel to show this information. If any errors occur during data retrieval or processing, appropriate error messages are shown to the user.

    • getNewsPanel

      public JPanel getNewsPanel()
      Returns the JPanel used to display news content.
      Returns:
      The news panel.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method for testing purposes. Initializes the NewsProvider with the endpoint provided as a command-line argument and displays the news.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments. The first argument should be the endpoint URL.
